original_title: Sri Lanka’s mid day shares edge down
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edge down in mid day trade on Monday, the market saw some selling pressure which moved the market on red, an analyst said.
All Share Price Index was down 1.06 percent or 98.39 points to 9,217.48, the most liquid index S&P SL20 was down 0.85 percent or 24.09 points to 2,809.36.

Over the weekend, the International Monetary Fund wanted a new predictable and orderly’ debt resolution process is needed for countries like Sri Lanka and Surinam which are not covered by existing frameworks, Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva has said.
According to analysts this didn’t heavily impact the markets sentiment and was solely on a wait and see approach until harder facts on the macro-economy hit the surface.
The market generated a revenue of 667 million rupees as at 1130 hours.
Top gainers were Lanka IOC, Richard Pieris and Expolanka. (Colombo/Feb27/2023
